elements.content: A novel coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), where L1 =1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) and L2 = m-phthalate anion, has been obtained by using an unusual crystallization process. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2, with a = 9.0521(18), b = 15.401(3), and c = 17.141(3) Å, α = β = γ = 90°, V = 2389.7(8) Å3, and Z = 4. The complex 1 composing a porous supramolecular architecture displays unprecedented four-connected topology of an 86 net in coordination polymer chemistry. Thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) and X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns for 1 are discussed in detail.
elements.clean_text: A novel coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), where L1 =1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) and L2 = m-phthalate anion, has been obtained by using an unusual crystallization process. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2, with a = 9.0521(18), b = 15.401(3), and c = 17.141(3) Å, α = β = γ = 90°, V = 2389.7(8) Å3, and Z = 4. The complex 1 composing a porous supramolecular architecture displays unprecedented four-connected topology of an 86 net in coordination polymer chemistry. Thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) and X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns for 1 are discussed in detail.

elements.content: A novel porous supramolecular architecture of Cu(II) coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n obtained by assembly of CuCl2·2H2O, 1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L1), and m-phthalate anion (L2) gives the first example of a 3D four-connected net with an unprecedented 86 topology in coordination polymer chemistry.
elements.clean_text: A novel porous supramolecular architecture of Cu(II) coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  obtained by assembly of CuCl2⋅2H2O, 1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L1), and m-phthalate anion (L2) gives the first example of a 3D four-connected net with an unprecedented 86 topology in coordination polymer chemistry.

elements.content: In the field of supramolecular chemistry, great interest has recently been focused on the crystal engineering of coordination frameworks due to their new topologies, intriguing architectures, intertwining phenomena, and potential applications in microelectronics, nonlinear optics, molecular selection, ion exchange, and catalysis. What is particularly attractive is the novel types of structural motifs observed in these species. Supramolecular chemistry has advanced to a stage at which it is possible to select molecular building blocks that will assemble into structures with specific and desired network topologies, so that a rational design of molecular solids with potentially interesting properties is possible. One approach to the rational design of crystalline solids has been to use organic molecules which, by their coordinating propensities, their geometry, and their relative stoichiometries, are naturally predisposed to form one of several well-categorized solid structure types or novel structure types. In our previous work we have studied some coordination polymers with flexible ligands used less often to design novel polymer materials. Here we aimed at coupling our interest in obtaining new frameworks with the desire to achieve a microporous structure. In this work, we selected flexible bidentate 1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L1) ligand and m-phthalate anion (L2) ligand which has been used to construct a coordination polymer with larger circuit. On the basis of the above selection, a polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1) containing a porous architecture was obtained. To the best of our knowledge this is the first molecular architecture with the unprecedented topology of a four-connected 86 net.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

In the field of supramolecular chemistry, great interest has recently been focused on the crystal engineering of coordination frameworks due to their new topologies, intriguing architectures, intertwining phenomena, and potential applications in microelectronics, nonlinear optics, molecular selection, ion exchange, and catalysis. What is particularly attractive is the novel types of structural motifs observed in these species. Supramolecular chemistry has advanced to a stage at which it is possible to select molecular building blocks that will assemble into structures with specific and desired network topologies, so that a rational design of molecular solids with potentially interesting properties is possible. One approach to the rational design of crystalline solids has been to use organic molecules which, by their coordinating propensities, their geometry, and their relative stoichiometries, are naturally predisposed to form one of several well-categorized solid structure types or novel structure types. In our previous work we have studied some coordination polymers with flexible ligands used less often to design novel polymer materials. Here we aimed at coupling our interest in obtaining new frameworks with the desire to achieve a microporous structure. In this work, we selected flexible bidentate 1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L1) ligand and m-phthalate anion (L2) ligand which has been used to construct a coordination polymer with larger circuit. On the basis of the above selection, a polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1) containing a porous architecture was obtained. To the best of our knowledge this is the first molecular architecture with the unprecedented topology of a four-connected 86 net.

elements.content:
Materials . All reagents and solvents for syntheses were purchased from commercial sources and used as received.

Physical Methods . A Perkin-Elmer 240 elemental analyzer was used to collect microanalytical data, and the FT-IR spectrum was recorded from KBr pellets in range 4000−400 cm-1 on a Mattson Alpha-Centauri spectrometer. TGA was performed from room temperature to 800 °C using a Perkin-Elmer TG-7 analyzer in nitrogen. X-ray powder diffraction data were obtained on a Rigaku D/max 2500v PC X-ray diffractometer using Cu Kα radiation.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

 Materials . All reagents and solvents for syntheses were purchased from commercial sources and used as received. 

 Physical Methods . A Perkin-Elmer 240 elemental analyzer was used to collect microanalytical data, and the FT-IR spectrum was recorded from KBr pellets in range 4000-400 cm-1 on a Mattson Alpha-Centauri spectrometer. TGA was performed from room temperature to 800 °C using a Perkin-Elmer TG-7 analyzer in  nitrogen. X-ray powder diffraction data were obtained on a Rigaku D/max 2500v PC X-ray diffractometer using Cu Kα radiation.

elements.content: Synthesis of 1,1 ‘ -(1,4-Butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L 1 ) . A mixture of imidazole (3.4 g, 50 mmol) and NaOH (2.0 g, 50 mmol) in DMSO (10 mL) was stirred at 60 °C for 1 h, and then 1,4-dichlorobutane (3.2 g, 25 mmol) was added. The mixture was cooled to room temperature after stirring at 60 °C for 2 h and then poured into 200 mL of water, and a white solid formed immediately, which weighed 4.1 g after drying in air. Anal. Calcd for C5H7N2:  C, 63.16; H, 7.37, N, 29.47. Found:  C, 63.11; H, 7.42; N, 29.31.
elements.clean_text: Synthesis of 1,1 ‘ -(1,4-Butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L  1   ) . A mixture of imidazole (3.4 g, 50 mmol) and NaOH (2.0 g, 50 mmol) in DMSO (10 mL) was stirred at 60 °C for 1 h, and then 1,4-dichlorobutane (3.2 g, 25 mmol) was added. The mixture was cooled to room temperature after stirring at 60 °C for 2 h and then poured into 200 mL of water, and a white solid formed immediately, which weighed 4.1 g after drying in air. Anal. Calcd for C5H7N2: C, 63.16; H, 7.37, N, 29.47. Found: C, 63.11; H, 7.42; N, 29.31.

elements.content: Synthesis of Complex 1 . A mixture of CuCl2·2H2O (0.171 g, 1 mmol), NaOH (0.08 g, 2 mmol), and m-phthalic acid (0.166 g, 1 mmol) in water was stirring for 10 min at 60 °C. Then L1 (0.190 g, 1 mmol) was added to the solution with stirring for 30 min and a blue precipitate was obtained. The blue solid, insoluble in common organic solvents, was filtered off, washed with water, and dissolved in a minimum amount of ammonia (14 M). Suitable blue single crystals were obtained by slow evaporation of the ammoniacal solution of the solid at ambient temperature. The crystals were collected, washed with water, and dried in air (yield:  71%). Anal. Calcd for C18H30CuN4O10:  C, 41.06; H, 5.70; N, 10.65. Found:  C, 41.48; H, 5.63; N, 10.89. IR (cm-1):  3432 (vs), 3127 (w), 2943 (m), 1607 (vs), 1560 (s), 1522 (m), 1449 (m), 1363 (s), 1237 (m), 1108 (s), 951 (w), 750 (m), 659 (m).
elements.clean_text: Synthesis of Complex 1 . A mixture of CuCl2⋅2H2O (0.171 g, 1 mmol), NaOH (0.08 g, 2 mmol), and m-phthalic acid (0.166 g, 1 mmol) in water was stirring for 10 min at 60 °C. Then L1 (0.190 g, 1 mmol) was added to the solution with stirring for 30 min and a blue precipitate was obtained. The blue solid, insoluble in common organic solvents, was filtered off, washed with water, and dissolved in a minimum amount of ammonia (14 M). Suitable blue single crystals were obtained by slow evaporation of the ammoniacal solution of the solid at ambient temperature. The crystals were collected, washed with water, and dried in air (yield: 71%). Anal. Calcd for C18H30CuN4O10: C, 41.06; H, 5.70; N, 10.65. Found: C, 41.48; H, 5.63; N, 10.89. IR (cm-1): 3432 (vs), 3127 (w), 2943 (m), 1607 (vs), 1560 (s), 1522 (m), 1449 (m), 1363 (s), 1237 (m), 1108 (s), 951 (w), 750 (m), 659 (m).

elements.content: Addition of Na2L2 (1 mmol) into a solution of CuCl2·2H2O (1 mmol) and L1 (1 mmol) in water also produced complex 1. The reactions with different Cu:L1:L2 molar ratios (1:0.5:1 or 1:2:1) gave the same product 1; this may be caused by the low solubility of 1.
elements.clean_text: Addition of Na2L2 (1 mmol) into a solution of CuCl2⋅2H2O (1 mmol) and L1 (1 mmol) in water also produced complex 1. The reactions with different Cu:L1:L2 molar ratios (1:0.5:1 or 1:2:1) gave the same product 1; this may be caused by the low solubility of 1.

elements.content: X-ray Crystallography . Crystallographic data and experimental details for structural analyses are summarized in Table . Single-crystal X-ray diffraction measurement of complex 1 was carried out on a Rigaku RAXIS-RAPID image plate diffractometer using the ω scan technique with Mo Kα. A multiscan absorption correction was applied to the data. A total of 2903 unique reflections (Rint = 0.0618), of which 2133 had I ≥ 2σ(I), were used in all calculations. The structure was solved with the direct method of SHELXS-977 and refined with full-matrix least-squares techniques using the SHELXL-978 program. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically, and the positions of hydrogen atoms on carbon atoms were calculated theoretically. Full-matrix least-squares refinement based on F 2 converged with R1 =0.0437, wR2 = 0.1058, and GOF = 0.946 with Flack parameters 0.07(3). Further details are provided in the Supporting Information.
elements.clean_text: X-ray Crystallography . Crystallographic data and experimental details for structural analyses are summarized in Table . Single-crystal X-ray diffraction measurement of complex 1 was carried out on a Rigaku RAXIS-RAPID image plate diffractometer using the ω scan technique with Mo Kα. A multiscan absorption correction was applied to the data. A total of 2903 unique reflections (Rint = 0.0618), of which 2133 had I ≥ 2σ(I), were used in all calculations. The structure was solved with the direct method of SHELXS-977 and refined with full-matrix least-squares techniques using the SHELXL-978 program. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined anisotropically, and the positions of hydrogen atoms on carbon atoms were calculated theoretically. Full-matrix least-squares refinement based on F 2 converged with R1 =0.0437, wR2 = 0.1058, and GOF = 0.946 with Flack parameters 0.07(3). Further details are provided in the Supporting Information.

Summary of X-ray Crystallographic Data for Complex1

chem formula C18H30CuN4O10 fw 526.00 color, habit blue, needle cryst size (mm3) 0.147 × 0.523 × 0.125 cryst syst orthorhombic space group Pna21 a (Å) 15.401(3) b (Å) 17.141(3) c (Å) 9.0521(18) α (deg) 90.00 β (deg) 90.00 γ (deg) 90.00 V (Å3) 2389.7(8) Z, d calcd (g cm-3) 4, 1.462 μ(Mo Kα) (mm-1) 0.972 F(000) 1100 θ range (deg) 1.78−27.48 h, k, l ranges 0−19 0−22 0−11 reflcns collcd/unique 19 960/2903 reflcns obsd [I > 2σ(I)] 2133 GOF on F 2 0.946 R1, a  wR2 b  (obsd) 0.0437, 0.1058 Δ/σ max, mean 0.001, 0.000 max, min peaks (e Å-3) 0.813, −0.359

a  R1 = ∑||F o| − |F c||/∑|F o|. b  wR2 = |∑w(|F o|2 - |F c|2)|/∑|w(F o)2|1/2, where w = 1/[σ2(F o 2) + (aP)2 + bP] and P = (F o 2 + 2F c 2)/3.

Selected bond distances and angles for complex 1 are listed in Table . Complex 1 is insoluble in water and common organic solvents, and the crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis cannot be obtained by evaporating an appropriate solution of 1. It is found that 1 can be dissolved in a concentrated solution of ammonia by segregating the L1 and L2 ligands from Cu cations owing to the coordinating role of ammonia toward the Cu(II) cation. So the crystals of {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1) was obtained by using unusual crystallization process through evaporating an ammoniacal solution of 1. It crystallizes in the interesting acentric orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2. In the crystal structure (Figure ) there is only one unique Cu(II) atom. Each Cu(II) center has a slightly distorted {CuN2O3} square pyramidal coordination sphere, with two nitrogen atoms from two L1 and two oxygen atoms from two L2 in the base plane and one water molecule in the top site. Each L1 is coordinated to two Cu(II) ions, and each L2 bridges two Cu(II) ions using two oxygen atoms.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Selected bond distances and angles for complex 1 are listed in Table . Complex 1 is insoluble in water and common organic solvents, and the crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction analysis cannot be obtained by evaporating an appropriate solution of 1. It is found that 1 can be dissolved in a concentrated solution of ammonia by segregating the L1 and L2 ligands from Cu cations owing to the coordinating role of ammonia toward the Cu(II) cation. So the crystals of {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1) was obtained by using unusual crystallization process through evaporating an ammoniacal solution of 1. It crystallizes in the interesting acentric orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2. In the crystal structure (Figure ) there is only one unique Cu(II) atom. Each Cu(II) center has a slightly distorted {CuN2O3} square pyramidal coordination sphere, with two nitrogen atoms from two L1 and  two oxygen atoms from two L2 in the base plane and one water molecule in the top site. Each L1 is coordinated to two Cu(II) ions, and each L2 bridges two Cu(II) ions using two oxygen atoms.

Selected Bond Distances (Å) and Angles (deg) for {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1) a

Cu(1)−N(1) 2.000(5) Cu(1)−O(1) 1.941(4) Cu(1)−OW1 2.336(4) Cu(1)−N(4)i 1.960(5) Cu(1)−O(3)ii 1.960(4) O(1)−Cu(1)−N(4)i 89.3(2) O(1)−Cu(1)−O(3)ii 177.97(19) N(4)i-Cu(1)−O(3)ii 92.3(2) O(1)−Cu(1)−N(1) 87.7(2) N(4)i-Cu(1)−N(1) 175.2(2) O(3)ii-Cu(1)−N(1) 90.6(2) O(1)−Cu(1)−OW1 94.28(19) N(4)i-Cu(1)−OW1 92.7(2) O(3)ii-Cu(1)−OW1 86.90(19) N(1)−Cu(1)−OW1 91.3(2)

a  Symmetry codes for 1:  (i) x − 1/2, −y + 1/2, z − 1; (ii) −x + 3/2, y − 1/2, z + 1/2. Bond lengths are given in Å and bond angles are given in deg.

Cu(II) ions are connected by L1 and L2 to form 3D framework, and there are two kinds of the smallest eight-membered circuits in the network (Figure ). Each circuit consists of eight copper(II) cations at the corners connected by four L1 molecules and four L2 anions, which make up eight edges. The length of the L1 edge is 11.9 Å, and length of the L2 edge is 9.7 Å. In circuit I Cu(II) ions are bridged by L1 and L2 alternatively, while in circuit II Cu(II) ions are bridged by ligands in the sequence of −Cu−L1−Cu−L1−Cu−L2−Cu−L2.
elements.clean_text: Cu(II) ions are connected by L1 and L2 to form 3D framework, and there are two kinds of the smallest eight-membered circuits in the network (Figure ). Each circuit consists of eight copper(II) cations at the corners connected by four L1 molecules and four L2 anions, which make up eight edges. The length of the L1 edge is 11.9 Å, and length of the L2 edge is 9.7 Å. In circuit I Cu(II) ions are bridged by L1 and L2 alternatively, while in circuit II Cu(II) ions are bridged by ligands in the sequence of -Cu-L1-Cu-L1-Cu-L2-Cu-L2.

elements.content: Two kinds of smallest eight-membered circuits in1. The symmetry operations are performed to generated the other seven Cu(II) sites from the Cu1 site of the asymmetric unit in circuits I and II.
elements.clean_text: 2  Two kinds of smallest eight-membered circuits in1. The symmetry operations are performed to generated the other seven Cu(II) sites from the Cu1 site of the asymmetric unit in circuits I and II.

elements.content: It is interesting that there exist 16 eight-membered circuits through the same copper(II) ion (eight circuits I and eight circuits II). As shown in Figure , the same Cu(II) ion is shared by eight circuits I and eight circuits II, respectively. Wells has systematically studied the topology of three-dimensional nets, and the topology of the complex 1 can be attributed to the platonic 3D 86 net, which is not specifically identified by Wells. Structures based on 3D four-connected nets such as well-known diamond-related structures (66 net), rare NbO-like type (6482-a and 6482-b net), and PtS-like type (4284 net), which have experimentally confirmed the topologies predicted by theory, have evoked wide attention. Wells listed no fewer than 20 topologically uniform examples of 3D four-connected nets, but so few types are represented in real cases. As far as we know, the present 3D four-connected 86 net is first example in coordination polymer chemistry.
elements.clean_text: It is interesting that there exist 16 eight-membered circuits through the same copper(II) ion (eight circuits I and eight circuits II). As shown in Figure , the same Cu(II) ion is shared by eight circuits I and eight circuits II, respectively. Wells has systematically studied the topology of three-dimensional nets, and the topology of the complex 1 can be attributed to the platonic 3D 86 net, which is not specifically identified by Wells. Structures based on 3D four-connected nets such as well-known diamond-related structures (66 net), rare NbO-like type (6482-a and 6482-b net), and PtS-like type (4284 net), which have experimentally confirmed the topologies predicted by theory, have evoked wide attention. Wells listed no fewer than 20 topologically uniform examples of 3D four-connected nets, but so few types are represented in real cases. As far as we know, the present 3D four-connected 86 net is first example in coordination polymer chemistry.

elements.content: Schematic topology for 86 nets of 1. There exist eight circuits I and eight circuits II through the same Cu(II) ion.
elements.clean_text: 3  Schematic topology for 86 nets of 1. There exist eight circuits I and eight circuits II through the same Cu(II) ion.

elements.content: There exist channels in the 3D supramolecular frameworks (Figure ). The channels are mainly occupied by the guest water molecules. Approximately 26.1% of the crystal volume is occupied by free water molecules with a volume of ca. 623 Å3 in each cell unit.
elements.clean_text: There exist channels in the 3D supramolecular frameworks (Figure ). The channels are mainly occupied by the guest water molecules. Approximately 26.1% of the crystal volume is occupied by free water molecules with a volume of ca. 623 Å3 in each cell unit.

elements.content: Channels in the 3D framework of1. Guest water molecules and hydrogen atoms are omitted for clarity.
elements.clean_text: 4  Channels in the 3D framework of1. Guest water molecules and hydrogen atoms are omitted for clarity.

elements.content: When the crystals were removed from the mother liquor, they immediately lost part of the water molecules. TGA was performed after part of their water molecules had evaporated, which showed the following three strikingly clean and well-separated weight loss steps:  an initial weight loss of 16.6% from room temperature to 110 °C, corresponding to the removal of remaining water molecule, followed by another weight loss of 36.8% (calcd:  36.1%) from 260 to 320 °C for evacuation of the L1 from the frameworks. The last weight loss of 28.3% (calcd:  28.5%) from 460 to 520 °C is mainly due to the combustion of L2. And the final product is attributed to CuO.
elements.clean_text: When the crystals were removed from the mother liquor, they immediately lost part of the water molecules. TGA was performed after part of their water molecules had evaporated, which showed the following three strikingly clean and well-separated weight loss steps: an initial weight loss of 16.6% from room temperature to 110 °C, corresponding to the removal of remaining water molecule, followed by another weight loss of 36.8% (calcd: 36.1%) from 260 to 320 °C for evacuation of the L1 from the frameworks. The last  weight loss of 28.3% (calcd: 28.5%) from 460 to 520 °C is mainly due to the combustion of L2. And the final product is attributed to CuO.

elements.content: The XRPD pattern taken on the polycrystalline sample (Figure a) indicates that the structure of the bulk sample is consistent with crystal structure of 1. The characteristic peaks of 1 began to disappear when the water molecules evolved from the sample by heating the sample to 110 °C, and the anhydrous compound displayed poor crystallinity (Figure b). The structure cannot be recovered when this sample was exposed to water for a period of time. The appearance of some new sharpening peaks in the XRPD pattern of the rehydrated sample (Figure c) indicates that a new phase appears, and the crystallinity increases drastically with the rehydration.
elements.clean_text: The XRPD pattern taken on the polycrystalline sample (Figure a) indicates that the structure of the bulk sample is consistent with crystal structure of 1. The characteristic peaks of 1 began to disappear when the water molecules evolved from the sample by heating the sample to 110 °C, and the anhydrous compound displayed poor crystallinity (Figure b). The structure cannot be recovered when this sample was exposed to water for a period of time. The appearance of some new sharpening peaks in the XRPD pattern of the rehydrated sample (Figure c) indicates that a new phase appears, and the crystallinity increases drastically with the rehydration.

elements.content: XRPD patterns for1 (a) taken at room temperature, (b) after heating to 110 °C, and (c) after rehydration for 5 h.
elements.clean_text: 5  XRPD patterns for1 (a) taken at room temperature, (b) after heating to 110 °C, and (c) after rehydration for 5 h.

elements.content: In conclusion, a novel porous supramolecular architecture of the coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1) with unprecedented four-connected topology of 86 net has been synthesized. The TGA and XRPD patterns implied that the framework of the compound cannot be recovered after loss of the water molecules through heating.
elements.clean_text: In conclusion, a novel porous supramolecular architecture of the coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1) with unprecedented four-connected topology of 86 net has been synthesized. The TGA and XRPD patterns implied that the framework of the compound cannot be recovered after loss of the water molecules through heating.

Synthesis of 1,1 ‘ -(1,4-Butanediyl)bis(imidazole) (L 1 ) . A mixture of imidazole (3.4 g, 50 mmol) and NaOH (2.0 g, 50 mmol) in DMSO (10 mL) was stirred at 60 °C for 1 h, and then 1,4-dichlorobutane (3.2 g, 25 mmol) was added. The mixture was cooled to room temperature after stirring at 60 °C for 2 h and then poured into 200 mL of water, and a white solid formed immediately, which weighed 4.1 g after drying in air. Anal. Calcd for C5H7N2:  C, 63.16; H, 7.37, N, 29.47. Found:  C, 63.11; H, 7.42; N, 29.31.

Synthesis of Complex 1 . A mixture of CuCl2·2H2O (0.171 g, 1 mmol), NaOH (0.08 g, 2 mmol), and m-phthalic acid (0.166 g, 1 mmol) in water was stirring for 10 min at 60 °C. Then L1 (0.190 g, 1 mmol) was added to the solution with stirring for 30 min and a blue precipitate was obtained. The blue solid, insoluble in common organic solvents, was filtered off, washed with water, and dissolved in a minimum amount of ammonia (14 M). Suitable blue single crystals were obtained by slow evaporation of the ammoniacal solution of the solid at ambient temperature. The crystals were collected, washed with water, and dried in air (yield:  71%). Anal. Calcd for C18H30CuN4O10:  C, 41.06; H, 5.70; N, 10.65. Found:  C, 41.48; H, 5.63; N, 10.89. IR (cm-1):  3432 (vs), 3127 (w), 2943 (m), 1607 (vs), 1560 (s), 1522 (m), 1449 (m), 1363 (s), 1237 (m), 1108 (s), 951 (w), 750 (m), 659 (m).

cln_elements.content:
A novel coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), where L1 =1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) and L2 = m-phthalate anion, has been obtained by using an unusual crystallization process. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2, with a = 9.0521(18), b = 15.401(3), and c = 17.141(3) Å, α = β = γ = 90°, V = 2389.7(8) Å3, and Z = 4. The complex 1 composing a porous supramolecular architecture displays unprecedented four-connected topology of an 86 net in coordination polymer chemistry. Thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) and X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns for 1 are discussed in detail.

There exist channels in the 3D supramolecular frameworks (Figure ). The channels are mainly occupied by the guest water molecules. Approximately 26.1% of the crystal volume is occupied by free water molecules with a volume of ca. 623 Å3 in each cell unit.

When the crystals were removed from the mother liquor, they immediately lost part of the water molecules. TGA was performed after part of their water molecules had evaporated, which showed the following three strikingly clean and well-separated weight loss steps:  an initial weight loss of 16.6% from room temperature to 110 °C, corresponding to the removal of remaining water molecule, followed by another weight loss of 36.8% (calcd:  36.1%) from 260 to 320 °C for evacuation of the L1 from the frameworks. The last weight loss of 28.3% (calcd:  28.5%) from 460 to 520 °C is mainly due to the combustion of L2. And the final product is attributed to CuO.
cln_elements.clean_text:
A novel coordination polymer {[Cu(L1)(L2)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), where L1 =1,1‘-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole) and L2 = m-phthalate anion, has been obtained by using an unusual crystallization process. It crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pna21, which belongs to the crystal class mm2, with a = 9.0521(18), b = 15.401(3), and c = 17.141(3) Å, α = β = γ = 90°, V = 2389.7(8) Å3, and Z = 4. The complex 1 composing a porous supramolecular architecture displays unprecedented four-connected topology of an 86 net in coordination polymer chemistry. Thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) and X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns for 1 are discussed in detail. 

There exist channels in the 3D supramolecular frameworks (Figure ). The channels are mainly occupied by the guest water molecules. Approximately 26.1% of the crystal volume is occupied by free water molecules with a volume of ca. 623 Å3 in each cell unit.  

When the crystals were removed from the mother liquor, they immediately lost part of the water molecules. TGA was performed after part of their water molecules had evaporated, which showed the following three strikingly clean and well-separated weight loss steps: an initial weight loss of 16.6% from room temperature to 110 °C, corresponding to the removal of remaining water molecule, followed by another weight loss of 36.8% (calcd: 36.1%) from 260 to 320 °C for evacuation of the L1 from the frameworks. The last  weight loss of 28.3% (calcd: 28.5%) from 460 to 520 °C is mainly due to the combustion of L2. And the final product is attributed to CuO.

decomposition temperature.type: evacuation of the L1 from the frameworks

cln_elements.content: Two kinds of smallest eight-membered circuits in1. The symmetry operations are performed to generated the other seven Cu(II) sites from the Cu1 site of the asymmetric unit in circuits I and II.
cln_elements.clean_text: 2  Two kinds of smallest eight-membered circuits in1. The symmetry operations are performed to generated the other seven Cu(II) sites from the Cu1 site of the asymmetric unit in circuits I and II.

cln_elements.content: Schematic topology for 86 nets of 1. There exist eight circuits I and eight circuits II through the same Cu(II) ion.
cln_elements.clean_text: 3  Schematic topology for 86 nets of 1. There exist eight circuits I and eight circuits II through the same Cu(II) ion.

metadata.title:
A Porous Supramolecular Architecture from a Copper(II) Coordination
Polymer with a 3D Four-Connected 86 Net
